verses.verse: Come down <S%H3381><s%>, and sit <S%H3427><s%> in the dust <S%H6083><s%>, O virgin <S%H1330><s%> daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%>; sit <S%H3427><s%> on the ground <S%H776><s%> without a throne <S%H3678><s%>, O daughter <S%H1323><s%> of the Chaldeans <S%H3778><s%>: for thou shalt no more <S%H3254><s%> be called <S%H7121><s%> tender <S%H7390><s%> and delicate <S%H6028><s%>.

Take <S%H3947><s%> the millstones <S%H7347><s%>, and grind <S%H2912><s%> meal <S%H7058><s%>; remove <S%H1540><s%> thy veil <S%H6777><s%>, strip <S%H2834><s%> off the train <S%H7640><s%>, uncover <S%H1540><s%> the leg <S%H7785><s%>, pass through <S%H5674><s%> the rivers <S%H5104><s%>.

Thy nakedness <S%H6172><s%> shall be uncovered <S%H1540><s%>, yea <S%H2781><s%>, thy shame shall be seen <S%H7200><s%>: I will take <S%H3947><s%> vengeance <S%H5359><s%>, and will spare <S%H6293><s%> no man <S%H120><s%>.
Our Redeemer <S%H1350><s%>, Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> is his name <S%H8034><s%>, the Holy One <S%H6918><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>.

Sit <S%H3427><s%> thou silent <S%H1748><s%>, and get <S%H935><s%> thee into darkness <S%H2822><s%>, O daughter <S%H1323><s%> of the Chaldeans <S%H3778><s%>; for thou shalt no more <S%H3254><s%> be called <S%H7121><s%> The mistress <S%H1404><s%> of kingdoms <S%H4467><s%>.

I was wroth <S%H7107><s%> with my people <S%H5971><s%>, I profaned <S%H2490><s%> mine inheritance <S%H5159><s%>, and gave <S%H5414><s%> them into thy hand <S%H3027><s%>: thou didst show <S%H7760><s%> them no mercy <S%H7356><s%>; upon the aged <S%H2205><s%> hast thou very <S%H3966><s%> heavily <S%H3513><s%> laid thy yoke <S%H5923><s%>.

And thou saidst <S%H559><s%>, I shall be mistress <S%H1404><s%> for ever <S%H5769><s%>; so that thou didst not lay <S%H7760><s%> these things to thy heart <S%H3820><s%>, neither didst remember <S%H2142><s%> the latter end thereof <S%H319><s%>.

Now therefore hear <S%H8085><s%> this <S%H5719><s%>, thou that art given to pleasures, that sittest <S%H3427><s%> securely <S%H983><s%>, that sayest <S%H559><s%> in thy heart <S%H3824><s%>, I am <S%H657><s%>, and there is none else besides me <S%H3427><s%>; I shall not sit as a widow <S%H490><s%>, neither shall I know <S%H3045><s%> the loss of children <S%H7908><s%>:

but these two <S%H8147><s%> things shall come <S%H935><s%> to thee in a moment <S%H7281><s%> in one <S%H259><s%> day <S%H3117><s%>, the loss of children <S%H7908><s%>, and widowhood <S%H489><s%>; in their full measure <S%H8537><s%> shall they come <S%H935><s%> upon thee <S%H7230><s%>, in the multitude of thy sorceries <S%H3785><s%>, and the great <S%H3966><s%> abundance <S%H6109><s%> of thine enchantments <S%H2267><s%>.

For thou hast trusted <S%H982><s%> in thy wickedness <S%H7451><s%>; thou hast said <S%H559><s%>, None seeth <S%H7200><s%> me <S%H2451><s%>; thy wisdom and thy knowledge <S%H1847><s%>, it hath perverted <S%H7725><s%> thee <S%H559><s%>, and thou hast said in thy heart <S%H3820><s%>, I am <S%H657><s%>, and there is none else besides me.

Therefore shall evil <S%H7451><s%> come <S%H935><s%> upon thee <S%H3045><s%>; thou shalt not know the dawning <S%H7837><s%> thereof <S%H1943><s%>: and mischief shall fall <S%H5307><s%> upon thee <S%H3201><s%>; thou shalt not be able to put it away <S%H3722><s%>: and desolation <S%H7722><s%> shall come <S%H935><s%> upon thee suddenly <S%H6597><s%>, which thou knowest not <S%H3045><s%>.

Stand <S%H5975><s%> now with thine enchantments <S%H2267><s%>, and with the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of thy sorceries <S%H3785><s%>, wherein <S%H834><s%> thou hast labored <S%H3021><s%> from thy youth <S%H5271><s%>; if so be thou shalt be able <S%H3201><s%> to profit <S%H3276><s%>, if so be thou mayest prevail <S%H6206><s%>.

Thou art wearied <S%H3811><s%> in the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of thy counsels <S%H6098><s%>: let now the astrologers <S%H1895><s%>, the star-gazers <S%H2374><s%>, the monthly <S%H2320><s%> prognosticators <S%H3045><s%>, stand up <S%H5975><s%>, and save <S%H3467><s%> thee from the things that shall come upon thee <S%H935><s%>.

Behold <S%H7179><s%>, they shall be as stubble; the fire <S%H784><s%> shall burn <S%H8313><s%> them <S%H5337><s%>; they shall not deliver themselves <S%H5315><s%> from the power <S%H3027><s%> of the flame <S%H3852><s%>: it shall not be a coal <S%H1513><s%> to warm <S%H2552><s%> at <S%H217><s%>, nor a fire to sit before <S%H3427><s%>.

Thus shall the things be unto thee wherein thou hast labored <S%H3021><s%>: they that have trafficked <S%H5503><s%> with thee from thy youth <S%H5271><s%> shall wander <S%H8582><s%> every one <S%H376><s%> to his quarter <S%H5676><s%>; there shall be none to save thee <S%H3467><s%>.
